images.name: JavaScript
images.description: JavaScript is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web. It enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications.

images.name: Webpack
images.description: Webpack is a tool that lets you compile JavaScript modules, also known as module bundler. Given a large number of files, it generates a single file (or a few files) that run your app.

images.name: Gatsby
images.description: GatsbyJS is a React-based, GraphQL powered, static site generator, that automates the optimization work, for blazingly fast websites.

images.name: GraphQL
images.description: GraphQL is a syntax that describes queries for data, and is generally used to load data from a server to a client.

images.name: React
images.description: React allows developers to create small to large web applications that can change data, without reloading the page. The main purpose of React is to be fast, scalable, and simple.

images.name: Redux
images.description: Redux takes away some of the hassles faced with state management in large applications.

images.name: TypeScript
images.description: TypeScript is a superset of the JavaScript. It's goal is to help catch mistakes early through a type system, to make JavaScript development more efficient.
